title: Get instruction bytes in JIT mode, Intel Pin
content:
I have an INS object in the instrumentation function, and I wish to get the actual bytes used to code this instruction. Looking at the INS functions, the closest I found was a function to disassemble it (show the assembly code), where I'm seeking for the actual bytes.
Assistance is highly appreciated.

comments.text: You can use INS_Address and INS_Size together.
@ExtremeCoders: I did not mean the size, but rather the actual bytes used for coding it. (I also edited the question to make it clear)
I meant to read the instruction bytes from memory by using the address and size.
@ExtremeCoders: Well, this is embarrassing. The bigger lesson I learned here is that a pintool can directly access the memory region of the binary it runs. Thank you!
